data.claim: Abstract Art to Digital Design: The Complete Translation Framework - 10 principles (Color Speaks, Negative Space, Process, Temperature, Scale/Weight, Rhythm, Balance, Direction, Depth, Harmony/Discord) can be directly applied to any digital interface. Kandinsky's color-emotion mapping (Yellow=aggressive, Blue=spiritual, Red=powerful, Green=peaceful) drives UI mood. Mondrian's grid constraints inform layout systems. The key insight: abstract art removed representation to reveal pure visual truth - digital design can use these same truths to create interfaces that communicate before users even read.
data.snippet: Proven through 10 studies + 1 synthesis + 5 production designs: Music App (rhythm/movement/color), Finance Dashboard (balance/scale/negative-space), Meditation App (temperature/harmony/depth), E-commerce (direction/contrast/discord), Creative Agency (process/gesture/asymmetry)
